news.title: Lucknow leads in rooftop solar panel installations in Uttar Pradesh under PM Surya Ghar Yojana
news.para: According to a press release, a total 11, 435 solar panels have become operational in Lucknow while the number of installed solar rooftop panels in Varanasi is 4088. Kanpur, Agra and Prayagraj are seeing fast installation of solar rooftop panels.

news.title: Hong Kong's New World Development replaces CEO Adrian Cheng
news.para: Hong Kong property behemoth New World Development announced Thursday that its chief executive officer Adrian Cheng has been replaced, as the firm reported an annual loss of over US$2.5 billion. On Thursday, the firm also announced losses attributable to shareholders totalling HK$19.68 billion (US$2.5 billion) in the year ending June 30, 2024 -- which will mark New World's first annual loss in two decades.

news.title: Shanghai and Shenzhen to lift home purchase restrictions to boost market
news.para: Shanghai and Shenzhen are set to lift key restrictions on home purchases to attract buyers and boost their real estate markets. The changes will allow people from other parts of China to buy homes in these cities. Both cities are expected to announce the changes soon, joining other Chinese cities that have abolished purchase restrictions.

news.title: Will take back Dharavi contract from Adani group if it disobeys Maharashtra government: Deputy CM
news.para: ​​On Wednesday, Mumbai Congress chief and Lok Sabha MP Varsha Gaikwad had claimed 80 per cent of shares of Dharavi Redevelopment Project Private Limited (DRPPL), which is helming the ambitious makeover, were held by Adani group, while the state government had the remaining 20 per cent.

news.title: Australia's REA Group raises takeover offer for Rightmove to $8.29 billion after rejections
news.para: The new proposal from REA, a property listing firm, comprises of an offer price of 775 pence apiece, a more than 17% premium to Rightmove's closing price on Thursday, as well as an additional special dividend of 6 pence per share.

news.title: NCLAT grants two weeks time for Supertech Township's settlement proposal
news.para: "In view of the fact that Appellant is circulating a proposal for resolution of the project to the bank as well as to the homebuyers, we grant two weeks opportunity to the Appellant to complete the proposal and circulate it to the bank as well as to all the homebuyers," said a three-member NCLAT bench.

news.title: Lucknow: Shine City promoter Rashid Naseem to be declared fugitive economic offender
news.para: Rashid has been charged with collecting approximately Rs 800 to Rs 1,000 crore from the public in the name of investment and duping them by failing to return any money.

news.title: Elcot IT Park in Coimbatore set to open in two weeks
news.para: The construction of the building began in 2020 and was supposed to be completed more than a year ago. However, multiple factors delayed the completion. More than 3,000 people are expected to be employed by IT companies once the building is thrown open for occupancy.

news.title: Belagavi development body faces setback in 29 acre land dispute
news.para: Buda notified a total of 160 acres of land for the residential project in 2007. However, the project has been pending for the past 17 years because the farmers owning 29 acres decided to fight a legal battle, due to which the whole project came to a halt.

news.title: Delhi: NGT asks DPCC to verify pollution charges against concrete plants
news.para: A resident of Sabhapur Extension approached NGT, complaining that the plants near the area were causing air and noise pollution. A tribunal bench, headed by Justice Prakash Shrivastava, directed DPCC on Sept 23 to assess the ground situation and take appropriate remedial actions.

news.title: Indore administration demolishes three houses for MOG lines project
news.para: ​​The three houses that were demolished were deemed to be in a dilapidated condition and posed a safety hazard,” SDM Nidhi Verma said, adding that the district administration had previously engaged with the affected families to discuss the redevelopment plans and provide them with alternative housing options.

news.title: UP government approves restructuring of cadre posts in urban development department
news.para: From the current sanctioned strength of 3,085, number of positions would increase to 6,686. New cadre services such as planning, environment, and animal welfare would be created to appoint specialised officials. For efficient results, ULBs will be divided into three categories on the basis of local population.

news.title: REPL receives SEBI's approval for SM-REIT
news.para: Pradeep Misra, CMD of REPL said, "SM-REITs will address multiple critical issues of real estate as asset class, such as liquidity, entry barrier, transactional costs and portfolio diversification."

news.title: HDFC sells $717 million of home loans to reduce credit book
news.para: The portfolio was sold to about half a dozen state-controlled banks through private deals, according to people familiar with the matter, who asked not to be identified as the information is not yet public.

news.title: WeWork Inc's plan to sell stake in Indian unit collapses
news.para: The deal cleared by the regulator, as per a June 18 order, involved a two-step process that would see WeWork Inc. and Embassy together selling a stake of about 40% to new investors.

news.title: HDIL's ex-promoter approaches NCLT seeking reconduct of insolvency process
news.para: In his application, Wadhawan has claimed that the value of the company was huge, but its resolution professional (RP), committee of creditors (CoC) and valuer chose to overlook the assets, including intangible assets, and possible cash flow from joint venture deals.

news.title: Banks cautious with home loans after HYDRAA action in Hyderabad
news.para: According to sources, many banks have now instructed their loan sanctioning teams to be extra vigilant even when all necessary documentation has been approved by relevant authorities such as the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC), Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) and RERA.

news.title: RLDA invites bids for development of 10,000 sq meter land in Mumbai
news.para: The site holds tremendous potential for high-end residential developments, luxury hotels, and Grade-A office spaces. The development of this railway land parcel is expected to positively impact the surrounding areas by driving economic growth and creating new job opportunities.

news.title: Goldfish Abode's MD arrested for cheating villa owners in Hyderabad
news.para: The complainant alleged that Chandrasekhar illegally executed the registration of villas through his directors between 2020 and 2023 in violation of the development agreement by sending additional directors. He is also accused of misappropriating Rs 6.81 crore, which was collected from the building owners citing corpus fund and maintenance charges.

news.title: IBBI amends rules to speed up insolvency resolution in housing sector
news.para: "This interim representative will have the same rights and duties as an authorised representative in meetings of the committee of creditors," the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India (IBBI) said in a statement on Thursday.
